content.text:
# Thai Linux Working Group

}}
Thai Linux Working Group (TLWG; ) is a group of volunteers working on free and open-source software to support Thai language. The organization was founded in September 1998 with NECTEC's support.
In 1999, TLWG created MATEL (Mandrake and Thai Extension Linux). This Linux distribution eventually got renamed to LinuxTLE.
In 2006, source code created by TLWG has been moved to GitHub
Projects
TLWG has created and continues to back several projects such as LinuxTLE, LibThai, SWATH, Fonts-TLWG. They also tweaked LaTeX to support Thai language.
References
External links

* [https://github.com/tlwg TLWG's official Github account]
